item.description:
The Connecticut Ballet at Levitt Pavillion forThe Performing Arts

Come down and picnic with us. The performance starts at 8:00.

FREE ADMISSION

A not-to-be missed dance event:

Beautifully trained dancers in a program
of classical and contemporary ballet.
Connecticut Ballet’s versatile dancers in
world premieres by Connecticut-based
choreographers Mitzi Adams, Ted Thomas
and former Zig Zag Ballet dancer Brian Carey
Chung!

Food and Drink:
The gates will be open 90 minutes prior to show-time for picnics on the Pavilion grounds. Alcohol is permitted, please be responsible with glass bottles. The concession stand will be open for all free and ticketed events. Ice cream, chips, candy, soda and water are available for sale. Or, experience fine dining at one of our area’s many wonderful restaurants before or after performances.

Parking:
There is free municipal parking all around, including in the lot we share with the Westport Public Library, and the Imperial Avenue and Jesup Green lots.

Rain Location: Saugatuck School, 170 Riverside AvenueParking at the Pavilion
Directions to Our Rain Location:
Saugatuck Elementary School
170 Riverside Avenue
Westport, Connecticut 06880
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the BW Scarf with piano keys fying on a pole
item.name: The Connecticut Ballet at Levitt Pavillion forThe Performing Arts
